name: shortsightedly
content:
shortsightedly adverb
(THOUGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving in a way that does not think enough about how an action will affect the future: Shortsightedly, the federal government has reduced its contributions dramatically. The regime shortsightedly promoted the formation of a workforce suitable for only low-skilled jobs.
More examplesFewer examplesThey shortsightedly used their savings to pay the bill.The newspapers promptly (if shortsightedly) declared it "The Greatest Day in History."

shortsightedly adverb
(SIGHT)
mainly UK (US usually nearsightedly) in a way that shows that a person can only clearly see objects that are close to them: Aunt Emily lifted the blind and peered shortsightedly at her through the window. He blinked shortsightedly at them, then shook his head and concentrated on the food again.
More examplesFewer examplesHe looked shortsightedly around him again and then recognized her in the crowd.She leaned forward and peered shortsightedly into the night.Joe squinted short-sightedly at the shape in the dimness.She stared short-sightedly at the faded writing.
